objtitle.title: Letter from Willey Reveley, c. 18 October 1791

objdescid.compdate: 1791Willey Reveley's letter to Blake is dated "Oct 18" in Reveley's hand, but the partial postmark stamp, "C OCT / 7", suggests it may have actually been posted by [1]7 October 1791. Bentley (*Writings* volume 2, page 1521) notes "The date of the letter is in some doubt [...] for though Reveley clearly dated the letter 'Oct 18', the numeral in the postmark is equally clearly a '7'. I cannot reconcile these facts." Blake's undated reply to Reveley was written on the back of the letter he received by post from Reveley. According to Essick (*Huntington*, page 185), "Blake refers to his willingness to engrave for Reveley 'by the end of January' some illustrations for James Stuart and Nicholas Revett, *The Antiquities of Athens*. Volume 3 (1794) of that work [...] includes 4 plates by Blake dated 3 April 1792 in the imprints. Thus, Blake must have written his note, a direct reply to Reveley's letter, shortly after 18 October 1791." See also the note on Number of Leaves, below.

objinfo.objsize: Full sheet 15.0-18.9 x 23.2 cm.Unfolded full sheet and Leaf Size dimensions (height x width) are given according to the vertical orientation of the body of Reveley's letter to Blake; see the note on Number of Leaves, below. Object 1 has been reoriented vertically in the Object View Page, as would be customary when reading the address.
objinfo.numberleaves: 2The full sheet bearing Reveley's letter (Object 2) was folded into two leaves, which were folded further to form a packet for posting. Blake's address (Object 1) appears on what would have been the exterior of the folded packet. The leaf bearing Object 1 is torn and the postmark partially missing. Blake's undated response to Reveley, not pictured, is written on the reverse side of the leaf bearing Blake's address (Object 1); see the note on Composition Date, above. Blake's letter to Reveley, dated c. October 1791, is also available as a separate work through the Index of Letters.

provenance.name: Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery
provenance.price: £84This price includes all items in lot 214 in the 1918 Linnell sale; see the note on provenance below.
provenance.note: John Linnell; sold from Linnell's estate, Christie's, 15 March 1918, not listed in the Linell auction catalogue but probably included with lot 214 with 12 other letters (Essick *Huntington*, pages 184 and 190; Keynes *Bibliography*, page 68 ); although Blake's letter to Reveley appears to be an unsent draft, no fair copy has been located.

repository.institution: Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery

objnote.p: The full sheet bearing Reveley's letter (Object 2) was folded into two leaves, which were folded further to form a packet for posting. Blake's address (Object 1) appears on what would have been the exterior of the folded packet. The leaf bearing Object 1 is torn and the postmark is partially missing. Blake's undated response to Reveley, not pictured, is written on the reverse side of the leaf bearing Blake's address (Object 1); see the note on Composition Date in the Work Information. Blake's letter to Reveley, dated c. October 1791, is available as a separate work through the Index of Letters.

desc.objtitle: Mr Reveleys Compts to Mr Blake, Object 2

objnote.p: The full sheet bearing Reveley's letter (Object 2) was folded into two leaves, which were folded further to form a packet for posting. Blake's address (Object 1) appears on what would have been the exterior of the folded packet. The leaf bearing Object 1 is torn and the postmark is partially missing. Blake's undated response to Reveley, not pictured, is written on the reverse side of the leaf bearing Blake's address (Object 1); see the note on Composition Date in the Work Information. Blake's letter to Reveley, dated c. October 1791, is available as a separate work through the Index of Letters.

if he wishes to engrave any
of Mr Pars's drawings for the
do them by the end of January
MrMr Reveley will be glad to SomeKeynes (*Letters*, page 4) reads "Some" as "some".
